required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Software Enhancements to the Respironics BiPAP autoSV Device Compared to BiPAP S/T Device
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of Software Enhancements to the Respironics BiPAP autoSV Device Compared to BiPAP S/T Device

brief_summary.textblock: This study is being undertaken to collect data from Respironics, Inc's BiPAP autoSV3 and compare with data from Respironics, Inc's BiPAP S/T device, to confirm that the algorithms in the BiPAP autoSV3 device can safely and effectively treat participants experiencing Comp SAS no worse than the BiPAP S/T device. This will be determined using a comparative, randomized design with the participants blinded to the therapy. Additionally, attempts will be made to blind the central scorer(s) with respect to which device is in use.

detailed_description.textblock:
Primary Hypothesis and end-point:
The use of the BiPAP autoSV3 device in participants with Comp SAS will treat those participants no worse than when compared to the BiPAP S/T device with respect to:
- Apnea-Hypopnea Index (AHI)
Secondary Hypothesis and end-points:
The use of the BiPAP autoSV3 device in participants with Comp SAS will treat those participants no worse than the BiPAP S/T device, with respect to:
- Sleep Variables
- REM, NREM and Total Sleep Time (TST) Indices
- Apnea Hypopnea Index (AHI)
- Center Apnea Index(CAI)
- Obstructive Apnea Index (OAI)
- Mixed Apnea Index (MAI)
- Hypopnea Index (HI)
- Sleep Onset Latency (SOL)
- REM Onset Latency (ROL)
- Wake After Sleep Onset (WASO)
- Total Sleep Time (TST)
- Sleep Efficiency (SE %)
- Wake (W), Stages N1,N2,N3 (NREM), and REM (R) sleep (in minutes)
- Wake (W), Stages N1,N2,N3 (NREM), and REM (R) sleep (% TST)
- Arousal Index [total, AH-related, PLM-related, 'spontaneous']
- Nocturnal oxygenation (measured by continuous pulse oximetry during sleep study)
- AHI (REM, NREM and TST) using modified hypopnea rule.
- AHI (REM, NREM and TST) during epochs for which leak is determined to exist within acceptable limits

primary_outcome.description: The number of apneas and hypopneas per hour of sleep.

secondary_outcome.description: The apnea hypopneas index is the number of apneas and hypopneas per hour of sleep while in REM (Rapid eye movement sleep).
The central apnea index is the number of central apneas divided by the number of hours of sleep.
The obstructive apnea index is the number of obstructive apneas per hour of sleep.
The mixed apnea index is a combination of both obstructive and central sleep apnea symptoms per hour.
The hypopnea index is number hypopneas per hour.
Sleep Onset Latency is the amount of time it takes to fall asleep after the lights have been turned off.
REM Onset Latency is the time it takes to fall into REM sleep.
Wake After Sleep Onset is the amount time a participant is awake after they have fallen asleep.
Total Sleep time is total amount of time a participant is asleep from lights off to lights on.
Sleep Efficiency is the percentage of time spent asleep while in bed.
The periodic limb movement is the number of periodic limb movements per hour of sleep.
The arousal index is the number of arousals or awakenings per hour of sleep.

secondary_outcome.measure: Stages N1,N2,N3 and REM (R) Sleep (% TST)
secondary_outcome.description: The average amount of time spent N1, N2, N3 and REM percent total sleep time per night.

secondary_outcome.measure: Stages N1,N2,N3 and REM (R) Sleep (in Minutes)
secondary_outcome.description: The average amount of time spent N1, N2, N3 and REM in minutes per night.

Measurement of oxygen saturation index over the course of the night as measured by continuous pulse oximetry. The oxygen saturation index is the number of times per hour of sleep that the blood's oxygen level drop by a certain degree from baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Apnea Hypopnea Index Using Modified Hypopnea Rule.
secondary_outcome.description: The apnea hypopnea index is the number of apneas and hypopneas that occur per hour of sleep using the modified hypopnea rule.

secondary_outcome.measure: Apnea Hypopnea Index(REM, NREM and TST) During Epochs for Which Leak is Determined to Exist Within Acceptable Limits.
secondary_outcome.description: The number of apneas and hypopneas per hour of sleep during which the leak is determined to exist within acceptable limits.

arm_group.description: Control Arm using Respironics BiPAP S/T
Treatment arm using Respironics BiPAP Auto SV3

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age 21-80.
- Ability to provide consent.
- Documentation of medical stability by investigator.
- Currently using BiPAP S/T (At least 4 weeks on therapy).
- Participants who previously demonstrated Complex Sleep Apnea (CSA), with a central apnea index (CAI) ≥5 during Diagnosis study or on Positive Airway Pressure (PAP) titration.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Participants, who are acutely ill, medically complicated or who are medically unstable.
- Participants in whom PAP therapy is otherwise medically contraindicated.
- Participants who are unwilling to wear PAP.
- Participants who are currently prescribed oxygen therapy.
- Participants with previously diagnosed respiratory failure or respiratory insufficiency and who are known to have chronically elevated arterial carbon dioxide levels while awake (PaCO2 ≥ 45mmHg).
- Participants who have had surgery of the upper airway, nose, sinus, or middle ear within the previous 90 days.
- Participants with untreated, non-obstructive sleep apnea (OSA)/CSA sleep disorders, including but not limited to; insomnia, periodic limb movement syndrome, or restless legs syndrome Periodic Limb Movement (PLM) Arousal Index > 15).
- Participants who are unwilling to participate in the study.

overall_official.affiliation: Medical Director of Med One Medical

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Patients were recruited from one site to evaluate software enhancements. The study enrolled patients in the spring of 2009.

group.title: Screening Population
group.description: All participants that signed consent are considered for the screening population.

group.title: Respironics BiPAP S/T First, Then Respironics BiPAP Auto SV3
group.description: Mechanical Non-invasive Ventilation first and then Auto Servo Ventilation Device

group.title: Respironics BiPAP Auto SV3 First, Then Respironics BiPAP S/T
group.description: Auto Servo Ventilation Device and then Mechanical Non-invasive Ventilation

baseline.population: The patients that were found eligible and were randomized are included in the baseline analysis.

group.title: All Participants
group.description: All participants that were consented.

outcome.title: Apnea Hypopnea Index
outcome.description: The number of apneas and hypopneas per hour of sleep.
outcome.population: One subject was excluded from analysis due to the subject chewing during the treatments causing the data to be unreliable. One subject had no pain related medical history and therefore was excluded from analysis.

outcome.description: Measurement of oxygen saturation index over the course of the night as measured by continuous pulse oximetry. The oxygen saturation index is the number of times per hour of sleep that the blood's oxygen level drop by a certain degree from baseline.
outcome.population: One subject was excluded from analysis due to the subject chewing during the treatments causing the data to be unreliable. One subject had no pain related medical history and therefore was excluded from analysis.

measure.title: Nocturnal Oxygenation Index
measure.description: Measurement of oxygen saturation index over the course of the night as measured by continuous pulse oximetry. The oxygen saturation index is the number of times per hour of sleep that the blood's oxygen level drop by a certain degree from baseline.
measure.population: One subject was excluded from analysis due to the subject chewing during the treatments causing the data to be unreliable. One subject had no pain related medical history and therefore was excluded from analysis.

outcome.title: Apnea Hypopnea Index Using Modified Hypopnea Rule.
outcome.description: The apnea hypopnea index is the number of apneas and hypopneas that occur per hour of sleep using the modified hypopnea rule.
outcome.population: The Apnea Hyopnea Index(AHI) was analyzed and results were provided. The AHI using the modified hypopnea rule was not conducted. This is not part of the standard sleep scoring and therefore was not completed. The was an error in the endpoint analysis.

group.title: Respironics BiPAP S/T
group.description: Control Arm using Respironics BiPAP S/T BiPAP S/T: Mechanical Non-invasive Ventilation

group.title: Respironics BiPAP Auto SV3
group.description: Treatment arm using Respironics BiPAP Auto SV3 BiPAP Auto SV3: Auto Servo Ventilation Device

measure.title: Apnea Hypopnea Index Using Modified Hypopnea Rule.
measure.description: The apnea hypopnea index is the number of apneas and hypopneas that occur per hour of sleep using the modified hypopnea rule.
measure.population: The Apnea Hyopnea Index(AHI) was analyzed and results were provided. The AHI using the modified hypopnea rule was not conducted. This is not part of the standard sleep scoring and therefore was not completed. The was an error in the endpoint analysis.

outcome.title: Apnea Hypopnea Index(REM, NREM and TST) During Epochs for Which Leak is Determined to Exist Within Acceptable Limits.
outcome.description: The number of apneas and hypopneas per hour of sleep during which the leak is determined to exist within acceptable limits.
outcome.population: The Apnea Hypopnea Index (AHI) was analyzed and results were provided. However the epochs were not separated out as this is not part of the standard sleep scoring and therefore was not completed. The was an error in the endpoint analysis.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
